name: Yejin Choi 0001
content: Yejin Choi Photo credit: Matt Hagen Yejin Choi The Dieter Schwarz Foundation Professor & Senior Fellow MacArthur Fellow Office: Gates 362 Phone: 650.725.4537 email: yejinc@stanford.edu Computer Science & HAI Stanford University 353 Jane Stanford Way Stanford, CA 94305 News: - Briefing at the United Nations Security Council - Named among TIME100 AI 2025 - Named among the AI2050 Senior Fellows in 2024 - Named among TIME100 AI 2023 - Panel at Davos: The Dawn of Artificial General Intelligence - Podcast "Unconfuse Me" with Bill Gates: Full episode here (audio-only) and Youtube highlights here (videos) - A TED talk: "Why AI is Incredibly Smart --- and Shockingly Stupid" - MacArthur Fellow (class of 2022); 2 min YouTube reel ‚Üíhere - Keynote at ACL: "2082: An ACL Odyssey: The Dark Matter of Language and Intelligence" along with a fireside chat on "The Trajectory of ACL and the Next 60 years" and a pre-recorded talk ‚Üíhere - An invited article, "The Curious Case of Commonsense Intelligence" for the Daedalus's special issue on AI & Society - A podcast interview with the Gradient on commonsense and morality - Featured by New Yorker: "Can Computers Learn Common Sense?" - The TWIML AI Podcast with Sam Charrington on "Why is language the best medium for reasoning?" - An interview by Dhruv Batra on Humans of AI: Stories, Not Stats - Featured by NY Times on Delphi: "Can a Machine Learn Morality?" - Featured by Quanta Magazine --- ü§ñ"Common Sense Comes Closer to Computers"ü§ñ - Our UW Sounding Board team is the winnner of the Alexa Prize! Awards: Best/Outstanding Paper Awards: - Best Paper Award at NeurIPS 2025 - Best Paper Award at EMNLP 2025 - Best Demo Paper Award at ACL 2025 - Outstanding Paper Award at ACL 2025 - Outstanding Paper Award at EMNLP 2023 - Best Paper Award at ACL 2023 - Outstanding Paper Award at ACL 2023 - Outstanding Paper Award at ICML 2022 - Best Paper Award at NAACL 2022 - Outstanding Paper Award at NeurIPS 2021 - Outstanding Paper Award at AAAI 2020 - Marr Prize at ICCV 2013 Test of Time: - Longuet Higgins Prize at CVPR 2021 - Test of Time Award at ACL 2021 Finalists: - IROS RoboCup Best Paper Finalist at IROS 2019 - Best Paper Nomination at ACL 2019 Recognition: - TIME100 AI (2025) - AI2050 Senior Fellow (2024) - TIME100 AI (2023) - Dieter Schwarz Foundation Professorship (2024 - current) - Distinguished Research Fellow at the Institute for Ethics in AI at Oxford (2023) - Wissner-Slivka Chair (2023 - 2024) - MacArthur Fellow (2022) - ACL Fellow (2022) - Brett Helsel Career Development Professorship (2020 - 2023) - Borg Early Career Award (BECA) (2018) - IEEE AI's 10 to Watch (2016) Research Interests üî•: AI for Science: Molecular foundation models at all scales and modalities, protein reasoning models, chrystal reasoning models, molecular reasoning and retrosynthesis Pluralistic Alignment & AI for humanity: Data and algorithms for pluralistic norms and values, deliberate alignment processes, civic discourse Alternative Training and Inference Algorithms: Test-time training, reinforced pre-training, alternative tokenization, cognitive architectures Recent Talks (2020 -
